thread.title_full: Dow Jones Top Company Headlines at 11 PM ET: Samsung Expects Earnings Improvement After Profit Drop | Microsoft's ... | Morningstar

title: Dow Jones Top Company Headlines at 11 PM ET: Samsung Expects Earnings Improvement After Profit Drop | Microsoft's ... | Morningstar
text:
Samsung Expects Earnings Improvement After Profit Drop
The world's largest maker of memory chips and smartphones posted lower quarterly net profit, but expects earnings to regain momentum in the second half of this year.
----
Microsoft's Cloud Unit, Bolstered by AI Demand, Supercharges Earnings
Much of company's recent growth has come through the cloud business, which AI companies have been using to host models.
----
Meta Shares Soar as Ad Business Continues to Fuel AI Ambitions
The Facebook parent's core ad business remains strong as the company is investing billions of dollars into artificial intelligence.
----
Qualcomm Logs Higher Profit as Chip Sales Rise
The software chip maker's quarterly results topped analysts' expectations, but shares fell in after-hours trading.
----
Grab Posts Second-Quarter Profit on Strong Consumer Demand
The Southeast Asian ride-hailing company expects a stronger second half of the year compared with the first half.
----
Ford Takes $800 Million Tariff Hit, Posts First Loss Since 2023
The levies on imported parts helped wipe out the company's net profit in the second quarter.
----
Arm Holdings Posts Lower First-Quarter Profit On Increase in Engineering Spending
The semiconductor company posted lower first-quarter earnings and issued second-quarter adjusted per-share earnings guidance mostly below Wall Street expectations.
----
Robinhood Second-Quarter Revenue Rose on Transaction Sales Growth
The retail trading platform posted a profit of $386 million for the quarter.
----
EBay Logs Higher Profit, Revenue On Strong Volumes
The online marketplace logged higher profit and revenue in the second quarter as gross merchandise volume rose. Shares jumped in after-hours trading.
----
CPKC Profit, Revenue Rise on More Shipments
Canadian Pacific Kansas City posted higher profit and revenue in the second quarter, as it shipped 7% more volume across its railroad network.
----
Pilgrim's Pride Logs Quarterly Beat as Consumers Look for Cheap Meat
The chicken and pork producer beat Wall Street expectations in the second quarter as consumers favored chicken as an affordable source of protein.
----
Comcast Earnings Are Nearly Here. This Number Is Key.
The media company's stock is down 13% this year. Here's what it needs to spark a change.
----
JD.com Unit to Buy Ceconomy
A unit of JD.com has offered to take over electronics retailer Ceconomy in a bid that values the German group at about $2.63 billion.
----
Airbus Backs Guidance After Trump, EU Reach Tariff Deal
The aerospace company confirmed its aircraft-delivery and financial targets for the year, but said its forecasts still excluded any impact from tariffs.
----
Renault Names Procurement Head Francois Provost as New CEO
The French carmaker picked a company veteran to steer it through a tough automotive market.
(END) Dow Jones Newswires
July 30, 2025 23:15 ET (03:15 GMT)
